definitions.definition: a short remark or message added to the bottom of a letter after you have signed your name, usually introduced by the abbreviation PS:
examples: There was the usual romantic postscript at the end of his letter - PS I love you.

definitions.definition: any written or spoken addition to something already finished:
examples: As a postscript to that story I told you last week, it turned out that the woman was his sister-in-law.
